title: Walk around Leyland Walking Route

images.title: Alexander P Kapp / Cross and Drinking Fountain, Towngate, Leyland
images.caption: Cross and Drinking Fountain, Towngate, Leyland

images.title: Alexander P Kapp / Leyland War Memorial
images.caption: Leyland War Memorial

images.title: Philip Wallbank / Leyland Motors Sculpture
images.caption: Leyland Motors Sculpture. Lifesize bronze sculpture of a foundry worker with the Leyland Motors Motif. Located close to Morrison's Store which is built on the previous Leyland Motors site.

images.title: Ann Cook / Leyland Cross
images.caption: Leyland Cross, Leyland, Lancashire. The "Cross", as it is simply known throughout Leyland, is believed to be medieval in date. It stands in what was once the centre of old Leyland. The drinking fountain replaces an old well which still exists below the surface. The old buildings and street behind have been demolished and a car park [for a well-known supermarket] now sadly dominate the area.

images.title: Alexander P Kapp / South Ribble Museum and Exhibition Centre
images.caption: South Ribble Museum and Exhibition Centre. The diverse collection includes medieval artifacts and archaeological discoveries, along with a social history archive and collections from industries such as cotton manufacture, rubber industry and Leyland Motors. You can find the centre on Church Road at postcode PR25 3FJ.

images.title: Keith Burroughs / Leyland Motors Clock, Leyland
images.caption: Leyland Motors Clock. The Clock is now situated in the middle of the roundabout in Leyland

images.title: Ann Cook / Miniature Railway
images.caption: Railway Worden Park. The miniature railway winds through woodland next to the car park in the centre of the park. The station, which can be seen in the rear of the photo, is the home of the Leyland Model Society and, on many weekends when they run their trains, rides are available to the public. This summer [2006] the track is being extended greatly and will eventually run through large areas of the park.

images.title: Ann Cook / Path through Worden Park
images.caption: Path through Worden Park

description: This Lancashire based town has some fine local parks and country trails to explore. This circular walk from the town visits Worden Park to the south of the town. The walk starts in the town centre in the Towngate area. From here it is a short stroll south to the entrance of Worden Park. The 150 acre park has well laid out footpaths taking you to woodland, formal gardens,a conservatory and a maze. After exploring the park you could visit the South Ribble Museum & Exhibition Centre located near the start of the walk. Here you can find out all about the history of the area including the famous Leyland Motors which was based in the town. The company manufactured lorries, buses and trolleybuses during the 20th century.
